docs.text: the only thing worse than watching a bad movie is realizing that the film had a lot of potential and could've been effective .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: such is the case with _urban legend_ , the new horror film from first time director jamie blanks .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the idea behind the movie is that the mad slasher of the film muders people according to various urban legends .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: examples include the killer in the backseat of the car and person getting calls from inside her house .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the killer wears one of those l . l . bean parkas with the hood drawn completely up , so you can't see the face .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i guess halloween masks are out of style for psychos these days .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: anyhow , the premise is certainly a nifty one and the opening scene is spooky and atmospheric .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's a very good setup that promises more chills to come .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: unfortunately , the film never takes off from there .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the movie takes place on a peaceful new england college campus .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: like most slasher flicks , this one also centers around a young female main character whose friends are slowly killed off by a knife wielding maniac ( or in this case an axe wielding maniac ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i've always wondered why these killers don't save themselves a lot of time and trouble and just go after the person they ultimately aim to kill .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: after the fine first scene , the movie degenerates into a monotonous series of those annoying you-thought-it-was-the-killer-but-was-just- someone-else scares .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: these are always accompanied by loud bursts of music .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i guess sudden , sharp music chords are what passes for terror these days .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the actual killer will attack at about every third music blast .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the slasher appears , attacks , the victim is eviscerated , and the tedious cycle appears anew .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: false scares should always be used in moderation .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: someone needs to tell director blanks that things like this just aren't as scary as they used to be .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this movie commits the biggest sin a horror film can commit--it's not frightening .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: remember the horror movie cliches that were so mercilessly mocked in _scream_ and _scream 2_ ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this movie still adheres to them .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: tons of illogical moments about ; more than i really have the inclination to list .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and i don't mean illogical in the summer popcorn movie sense .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: that type of illogical can be fun .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this film insults your intelligence more times than i care to remember .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the last 20 minutes especially degenerates into such lunacy that you'll be laughing more than you'll be screaming .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: actually , you won't be screaming at all .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: at its best , the acting can barely be called " adequate " and the script could've definitely used a rewrite or two .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film still manages to have some strong points .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the killings are certainly inventive and plentiful enough to satistfy most gore fans .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there are some intentionally funny moments .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ( these were exceeded by the unintentional ones . )
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film is well made from a technical standpoint .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: besides the first part , there is also another good scene , a prolonged cat and mouse chase inside a radio station .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: if there had only been more sequences like this , that relied on tautness and suspense rather than loud bursts of music , _urban legend_ might've been worth your money .
docs.label: negative
